facts_entailed: The histopathological hallmark of AR-RTD is the absence or incomplete development of cortical convoluted proximal tubules.
Since its description by Allanson et al. in 1983, over 100 cases of AR-RTD with or without genetic defects have been reported.
While most previous reports have described AR-RTD as a lethal condition.

 early diagnosis and prognosis are essential to effectively control sepsis , prevent the incidence of mods or mof , and reduce mortality in children with sepsis .

The aminoglycoside and macrolide families of antibiotics disrupt RNA translation in prokaryotes by targeting ribosomal (rRNA).

central neuropathic pain ( central pain ) is pain caused by a disease or lesion in the central nervous system . 
 central pain develops in about 8% of stroke patients ( andersen et al 1995 ) , 25% of patients with multiple sclerosis ( osterberg et al 2005 ) , and 40%50% of patients with spinal cord injury ( budh et al 2003 ; siddall et al 2003 ; werhagen et al 2004 ) and may develop secondary to brain and spinal cord tumors and other diseases affecting the central nervous system .

facts_entailed: Central neuropathic pain, also known as central pain, is pain caused by a disease or lesion in the central nervous system.
About 8% of stroke patients develop central pain according to Andersen et al. (1995).
Approximately 25% of patients with multiple sclerosis develop central pain according to Osterberg et al. (2005).
Central pain affects 40-50% of patients with spinal cord injury, as reported by Budh et al. (2003), Siddall et al. (2003), and Werhagen et al. (2004).
Central pain affects a large number of patients worldwide.

In respect of microbiology, it has led to a long debate of the species concept as it applies to prokaryotes.

facts_entailed: The technique of lymphatic mapping and sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) has emerged in the last two decades as a minimally invasive approach to evaluate regional lymph node basins in patients with intermediate and high-risk primary cutaneous melanoma.
SLNB is now recommended as a staging procedure for patients with t2, t3, or t4 melanomas and clinical uninvolved regional lymph nodes (clinical stage ib and ii).
SLNB is suggested also for patients with t1 melanomas and pathologic features associated with an increased risk of nodal micrometastases (ulceration, high mitotic rate, ).
Positron emission tomography (PET) with 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose (18F-FDG) has been extensively investigated in patients with melanoma.
Plenty of studies have shown the effectiveness of PET with 18F-FDG in patients with melanoma.

source: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( copd ) is characterized by progressive and partially reversible airflow limitation , and it is among the leading causes of mortality worldwide.1 copd is a multicomponent disease , and patients present a range of comorbidities that have an impact on prognosis and may increase the risk of mortality.2 the effects of copd on respiratory and physical function have been well studied ; moreover , due to the heavy burden of psychological disturbance , psychiatric morbidity , and disability in daily life , the mental health of copd patients has received growing attention in recent years.3,4 the prevalence of cognitive impairment in patients with copd ranges from 12% to 88%5 and is associated with depression , poor quality of life , which may affect patients a
facts_entailed: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is characterized by progressive and partially reversible airflow limitation.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is among the leading causes of mortality worldwide.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a multicomponent disease.
Patients with COPD present a range of comorbidities that impact prognosis and increase the risk of mortality.
The effects of COPD on respiratory and physical function have been well studied.
Due to psychological disturbance, psychiatric morbidity, and disability in daily life, the mental health of COPD patients has received growing attention in recent years.
The prevalence of cognitive impairment in patients with COPD ranges from 12% to 88%
Cognitive impairment in COPD patients is associated with depression, poor quality of life.

intestinal helminths are among the most common and widespread of human infections , contributing to poor nutritional status , anemia and impaired growth  ( 1 ) . 
 intestinal helminthiases are also known to aggravate pre - existing anemia by decreasing appetite and thus food and iron intake ( 2 , 3 ) . 
 worldwide , anemia is an important reproductive health problem because of its association with adverse pregnancy outcome such as increased rates of maternal and perinatal mortality , premature delivery , low birth weight , etc ( 4 ) . 
 women in developing countries spend half of their reproductive lives pregnant and lactating and a high proportion of women in developing countries become anemic during this period .

facts_entailed: Anemia is an important reproductive health problem worldwide, associated with adverse pregnancy outcomes like increased maternal and perinatal mortality, premature delivery, and low birth weight.
A high proportion of women in developing countries become anemic during their reproductive period.
Women of reproductive age who are iron deficient but not anemic may become anemic.

emergence of bacterial resistance to many different antibiotics is considered as a great concern in human health . 
 pseudomonas aeruginosa ( pa ) has been recognized as one of the significant pathogens of nosocomial infections ( 1 ) . 
 key mechanism of antibiotic resistance in p. aeruginosa is the expulsion of antibiotics through multidrug resistance ( mdr ) efflux systems belonging to the resistance - nodulation - division ( rnd ) family ( 2 ) . 
 mexab - oprm , mexcd - oprj , mexef - oprn , mexxy , mexjk and mexvw contribute the most significantly to antibiotic resistance ( 3 ) and play an important role in intrinsic and acquired multidrug resistance ( 2 ) .

facts_entailed: Emergence of bacterial resistance to many different antibiotics is considered a great concern in human health.
Pseudomonas aeruginosa (PA) has been recognized as one of the significant pathogens of nosocomial infections.

The key mechanism of antibiotic resistance in P. aeruginosa is the expulsion of antibiotics through multidrug resistance (MDR) efflux systems belonging to the resistance-nodulation-division (RND) family.
MexAB-OprM, MexCD-OprJ, MexEF-OprN, MexXY, MexJK, and MexVW contribute the most significantly to antibiotic resistance and play an important role in intrinsic and acquired multidrug resistance.
The resistance of P. aeruginosa to multiple antibiotics is largely attributable to the expression of the MexAB-OprM efflux pump.

facts_entailed: In the past, a number of studies have given insight into the epidemiology of primary open-angle glaucoma.
For Caucasians, it is estimated that almost 2% of the population will suffer from the disease.
For Afro-Caribbeans, this percentage goes to almost 8%.
According to the World Health Organization, age-related cataract causes 48% of world blindness.
In the United States, age-related lenticular changes have been reported in 42% of those between the ages of 52 and 64 years.
60% of those between the ages of 65 and 74 years have been reported to have age-related lenticular changes.
91% of those between the ages of 75 and 85 years have been reported to have age-related lenticular changes.
Therefore, it is almost inevitable that a glaucoma patient will sooner or later need to undergo cataract surgery independently from his chronic disease.

Dental amalgam is ranked fifth among mercury-added products.

facts_entailed: The prevalence of sarcoidosis in Australia is 4.46.3 patients per 100,000 personyears.
In the United States, the prevalence of sarcoidosis is similar to that in Australia.
Sarcoidosis is a rare condition.
Sarcoidosis is a multisystem granulomatous disorder of unknown etiology.
Sarcoidosis predominantly affects young and middle-aged adults.

Diagnostic criteria for sarcoidosis are based on compatible clinical and radiological features supported by histological evidence of noncaseating granulomas in affected tissues and the exclusion of other causes of granulomatous inflammation.
Pulmonary infiltration and hilar lymphadenopathy are the most common findings in more than 90% of cases.
Transbronchial lung biopsy is recommended as the diagnostic procedure.
Other organs involved in sarcoidosis include skin, eyes, liver, spleen, and h.

facts_entailed: Apratoxins are potent cytotoxins derived from marine cyanobacteria.

Because of their biological activity and intriguing structures, we recently established that apratoxins prevent cotranslational translocation and thereby downregulate various receptors, including receptor tyrosine kinases (RTKs).
Apratoxins inhibit trafficking of other secretory molecules, including growth factors that act on RTKs.
RTKs such as epidermal growth factor receptors and corresponding ligands such as vascular endothelial growth factor A (VEGF-a) individually are validated drug targets.
The combined indirect inhibition of both classes of molecules by apratoxins results in the approval of small molecules and antibodies against these proteins for colorectal cancer and other cancers.

Hyperglycemic hyperosmolar syndrome (HHS) is a metabolic emergency.
The proposed criteria for HHS include a plasma glucose concentration > 33.3 mmol/L.

facts_entailed: stress urinary incontinence (sui), pelvic organ prolapse, and chronic pelvic pain are frequent complaints of women in perimenopause and menopause.
Anatomical disorders such as loss of support for the bladder base and the proximal urethra are a direct cause of stress urinary incontinence.
Changes in the configuration of these structures and disorders in their functioning are among the causes of stress urinary incontinence.
Weakening of connective tissue structures and loosening of connections within the pelvic floor are among the causes of these changes.
It is believed that the menopause plays the most significant role in these changes.

These springs are hubs of diverse microflora.
Metagenomics has helped microbiologists to reveal the genomes of the majority of non-cultivable microbes.
Metagenomics has contributed to a better understanding of global microbial ecology and the development of novel enzymes.
Advances in metagenomics have uncovered hidden aspects of microbial ecology.
Odisha is rich in biodiversity due to seasonal/climatic variations.
Odisha has various hot springs located in different geographical locations.
These springs vary in both physical/chemical characteristics and microbiology.

A case of an adult with hsct-tma was successfully treated with eculizumab.
Several factors have been implicated in the endothelial damage leading to hsct-tma: calcineurin inhibitors, acute graft-versus-host disease (gvhd), and cytomegalovirus (cmv) infection.

Thymic neuroendocrine (ne) tumors are rare, variably documented in 1 - 8% cases.
Transcervical thymectomy (tct) at the time of parathyroid surgery for phpt usually prevents thymic neomas.
The occurrence of thymic neomas is very rare after tct as part of the parathyroidectomy procedure for phpt.

hemifacial spasm is a disorder of the seventh cranial nerve , and is characterized by irregular , involuntary and recurrent tonic and clonic contractions of the ipsilateral facial expression muscles . 
 each spontaneous motor paroxysm starts with eye twitching and progresses to involve the other muscles innervated by the facial nerve . 
 the episode characteristically begins with a series of twitches that increase in frequency and intensity , followed by a sustained spasm . 
 the disorder is typical during adulthood and is commonly attributed to vascular compression of the facial nerve emergence at the brain stem .

facts_entailed: the episode of hemifacial spasm typically begins with a series of twitches that increase in frequency and intensity, followed by a sustained spasm.
hemifacial spasm is common during adulthood and is often attributed to vascular compression of the facial nerve emergence at the brain stem.
posterior fossa or cerebellopontine angle tumors are rare causes of hemifacial spasm, reported in less than 1% of adult patients.
posterior fossa or cerebellopontine angle tumors are not common causes of hemifacial spasm in children.

facts_entailed: The varicella zoster virus (VZV) is a neurotropic DNA alpha herpesvirus that infects more than 95% of the world population.
Varicella usually results from primary infection.
After reactivation, VZV moves transaxonally to the skin resulting in zoster.
Less often, VZV reactivation leads to neurologic complications, which are more common in immunocompromised patients.
Vasculitis has been reported in patients with dermatomal herpes zoster infection without trigeminal nerve involvement.
The average time from rash to neurologic symptoms and signs is 4.1 months.
Sporadically, the patient can present with rash and stroke simultaneously.

facts_entailed: The definition of street children differs across countries and cultures.
One way to identify street children is by categorizing their background according to their relationship to their family of origin.
Children on the street include those working on the street who maintain more or less regular ties with their families.
Children of the street maintain only weak relations with their families.
Abandoned children have no ties with their biological families and are completely on their own.

 nonetheless , a growing body of evidence suggests that multiple organ failure ( mof ) may develop during sepsis mainly as a consequence of impaired cellular oxygen utilization . 
 supportive data in patients include the following findings : total body oxygen consumption falls progressively with increasing seve
facts_entailed: Sepsis is the systemic inflammatory response to infection and represents a major cause of morbidity and mortality in patients admitted to intensive care units (ICUs).
However, despite decades of research, the pathophysiology of sepsis remains incompletely understood.

A critical limitation of tissue oxygen delivery due to macrocirculatory or microcirculatory failure may play a role, especially in the early phase of the disease process before resuscitation has been initiated.
Nonetheless, a growing body of evidence suggests that multiple organ failure (MOF) may develop during sepsis mainly as a consequence of impaired cellular oxygen utilization.
Supportive data in patients include the following findings: total body oxygen consumption falls progressively with increasing severity.

facts_entailed: An efficient photocatalyst minimizes recombination of photoexcited electron-hole pairs and maximizes electron and hole transfer to the adsorbate upon consecutive surface reactions.
In general, the photocatalytic activity of a given particle system depends on multiple factors.

For a reliable photoactivity assessment, relative contributions from the particles' bulk and interfaces have to be sorted out, and their impact to the overall performance requires a careful evaluation.

Gastrointestinal endosonography (known as EUS) has been in use as a routine procedure for more than 15 years at large hospitals performing high-complexity procedures.

facts_entailed: Direct coronary stent implantation is an elegant technique for coronary artery revascularization.

Several strategies and technologies have been developed to address the problem of heavily calcified coronary lesions, including simple dilatation using standard non-compliant balloon, cutting balloon, and plaque modification using rotational atherectomy.
We report on the management of an underexpanded bare-metal stent.

facts_entailed: hemicrania continua (hc) is an uncommon primary headache disorder characterized by a continuous, mild to moderate intensity, unilateral headache.
Most patients will experience superimposed exacerbations of more severe pain, often associated with ipsilateral autonomic symptoms.

Headache lasts for more than 3 months and fulfills the following criteria: unilateral pain without side shift, daily and continuous, without pain-free periods, moderate intensity, but with exacerbations of severe pain.
During exacerbations, at least one of the following autonomic features occurs: conjunctival injection and/or lacrimation, nasal congestion and/or rhinorrhea, ptosis and/or miosis.

 more children will be diagnosed with asd this year than with aids , diabetes , and cancer combined . 
 a diagnosis of autism is based on observed behavior and educational and psychological testing . currently , there is no single definitive treatment for autism , nor is there presently a cure .

facts_entailed: A diagnosis of autism is based on observed behavior and educational and psychological testing.
Traditional treatments for autism may include biomedical, sensory, behavioral, developmental, sports-related, or arts-based approaches.

phantom limb pain ( plp ) is classified as a kind of neuropathic pain that is induced after nerve injury . 
 it is an after effect of amputation occurring in up to 50 - 85% of the patients,[13 ] and often leads to significant impairment in occupational and social functioning . 
 daily pain is reported by 48% of patients with plp and it is supposed that these symptoms potentially affect their quality of life . more importantly , emotional factors are influential in patients experience of prolonged pain in a phantom limb after amputation . 
 on the one hand , it is likely that phantom pain develops poor health - related quality of life such as emotional problems including anxiety and depression . on the other hand , 
 it is also possible that poor quality of life due to emotional problems in
facts_entailed: Phantom limb pain (PLP) is classified as a kind of neuropathic pain induced after nerve injury.
Phantom limb pain occurs in up to 50-85% of patients after amputation.
Daily pain is reported by 48% of patients with PLP.
The symptoms of PLP can significantly impair occupational and social functioning.
Emotional factors are influential in the experience of prolonged pain in phantom limbs after amputation.
Poor health-related quality of life is likely to develop due to phantom limb pain including emotional problems like anxiety and depression.
Poor quality of life due to emotional problems may also occur.

 the etiology of domv has been recognized in the abnormal fusion of the endocardial cushions and abnormal development of the mitral valve during the delamination process . 
 transthoracic echocardiography is the modality of choice for the characterization of this anomaly ; in this respect , the parasternal short - axis view allows a full morphologic characterization of the anomaly and should always be performed in the case of a meaningful clinical suspect .

facts_entailed: The etiology of domv involves the abnormal fusion of the endocardial cushions and abnormal development of the mitral valve during the delamination process.
Transthoracic echocardiography is the preferred modality for characterizing this anomaly.

the largest mercury processing in the western hemisphere was in huancavelica in the peruvian andes , now a town of 30,000 people situated at 3676  m altitude . 
 the extensive mercury deposits have been mined since pre - hispanic times , they are just above the present town at ~4000  m. although the mine closed 30 years ago , mining continues on small scales . 
 the legacy of 500 years of mercury mining is now found in the city trenches and waterways , which are lined with mercury but this legacy is less evident in today 's inhabitants of huancavelica . 
 mining is a dangerous , unhealthy occupation but nowhere was it more health threatening than in colonial south america , especially in huancavelica . 
 the widespread ecological impacts of mining in the andes such as landscape destruction
facts_entailed: Today's inhabitants of Huancavelica do not exhibit a noticeable legacy of mercury mining.
Mining is a dangerous, unhealthy occupation, and it was particularly health-threatening in colonial South America, especially in Huancavelica.

facts_entailed: High-grade gliomas, who grade III or IV, are the most common primary brain tumors in adults.
GBM is the most aggressive malignant primary brain tumor.
Despite limited significant advances in standard therapy, notably temozolomide, median overall survival (OS) remains low: 15 months for newly-diagnosed GBM.
57 months for recurrent/relapsed GBM in a clinical trial setting.
The current standard of care in a clinical trial setting includes radiotherapy plus temozolomide followed by 6 cycles of adjuvant temozolomide.

facts_entailed: The tumor-like lesion is called adrenal myelolipoma.
It is composed of variable amounts of mature adipose tissue and bone marrow elements.
WBC and RBC precursor cells such as megakaryocytes are present within the lesion.
Giercke first described adrenal myelolipoma in 1905.
Oberling coined the term myelolipoma 24 years after Giercke's description.
Only two cases under the age of 16 have been reported, and this patient is the youngest pediatric case in the English literature.
A 11-year-old girl presented with recurrent abdominal pain over a year, with symptoms worsening over the past five months.
An ultrasound of the abdomen revealed a well-encapsulated, hypoechoic lesion in the right suprarenal region measuring 27.1 x 24.3 mm.
A contrast-enhanced computed tomography scan was performed.

nutcracker syndrome is generally referred to as the compression of the left renal vein between the superior mesenteric artery and aorta ( 1 ) . 
 this compression leads to lrv hypertension and results in direct communication of the renal vein with the calyceal cavity and the varicosities of the collateral pathway of the lrv ( 2 ) . 
 renal varicosities or abnormal branching of the superior mesenteric artery from the aorta are the most common factors considered responsible for this condition ( 1 , 2 ) . the other causes , such as compression of the retroaortic lrv between the aorta and spine ( which is referred to as ' posterior ncs ' in contrast to the more common ' anterior ncs ' ) or aberrant right renal artery constricting the lrv , are uncommon ( 3 , 4 ) . however , three recently repo
facts_entailed: Nutcracker syndrome is generally referred to as the compression of the left renal vein between the superior mesenteric artery and aorta.
Renal varicosities or abnormal branching of the superior mesenteric artery from the aorta are the most common factors considered responsible for this condition.

Compression of the retroaortic left renal vein between the aorta and spine, which is referred to as 'posterior ncs', and compression of the left renal vein by an aberrant right renal artery causing constriction, are uncommon causes.

facts_entailed: Since the international subarachnoid trial, coil embolization of aneurysms is now accepted as a primary optional treatment.
Endovascular treatment (EVT) of middle cerebral artery (MCA) aneurysms has been less often applied in many institutions due to the feasibility of surgical clipping and favorable outcomes.
Treatment of wide-necked and fusiform MCA aneurysms using EVT remains challenging.
Self-expandable stents became available, allowing many complex aneurysms to be treated by coil embolization.
To the best of our knowledge, there are a few reports regarding stent-assisted EVT of aneurysms.

facts_entailed: Mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome has affected infants and young children in Japan.

Diagnosis of mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome requires fever and 4 out of 5 principal clinical features: conjunctivitis, erythematous lips, oral cavity, palms and soles, and polymorphous exanthema of the body trunk; or fewer than 4 features with documented coronary artery disease as determined by echocardiography or coronary angiography.
Cardiac, particularly coronary artery complications, are well-known in mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome.
We are reporting 5 cases of mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome in 7-year-old boys with a history of Kawasaki disease presenting with coronary artery abnormalities.
A 7-year-old boy with a documented history of Kawasaki disease at the age of 1 year is being treated conservatively.

facts_entailed: The techniques allow the detection of single base changes in genomic DNA.
These techniques have had a major impact on understanding human genetic diseases.
Specific mutations identified through these techniques can result in disease.
DNA polymorphisms identified through these techniques are used as genetic markers in linkage studies.
Detection of beta globin gene lesions in thalassemic patients and carriers is based on screening for mutations specific to the relevant ethnic group.
In circumstances involving an unknown mutation, difficulties arise in prenatal diagnosis for at-risk couples presenting with unusual beta globin mutations.
Before fetal sampling, the nature of the parental beta thalassemia alleles must be determined.

tendinopathy is an overuse tendon injury that occurs in loaded tendons and results in pain and functional impairment , a major problem in sports and occupational medicine . 
 characteristic changes in tendon structure include loss of type i collagen , increase in proteoglycan content , and neovascularization . 
 this has been termed failed healing response and results in the tendon being less capable of sustaining repeated tensile load . 
 recently , a new pathology model has been accepted to explain the clinical course of tendinopathy . 
 the cook and purdam model states there is a continuum of tendon pathology that , for easier clinical use , has been divided into 2 clear groups : reactive tendinopathy / early tendon disrepair and degenerative tendinopathy / late tendon disrepair . becau
facts_entailed: This has been termed a failed healing response and results in the tendon being less capable of sustaining repeated tensile load.
Recently, a new pathology model has been accepted to explain the clinical course of tendinopathy.

The Cook and Purdam model states there is a continuum of tendon pathology that, for easier clinical use, has been divided into two clear groups: reactive tendinopathy/early tendon disrepair and degenerative tendinopathy/late tendon disrepair.

livestock animals are subjected to a huge sort of stress factors , such as environmental conditions , animal management or diets that may disrupt the intestinal ecosystem and increase the risk of pathogenic infections . in the swine industry , transition from the liquid to a solid diet during weaning and post - weaning are critic processes due to an important decrease of feed intake , impairing animal performance , immune function , microbiota and therefore , gut homeostasis . 
 concerning the immune system , these performance stages lead to the end of transference of passive maternal immunity from the sows to the piglets which still have an immature or developing immune system .

facts_entailed: Livestock animals are subjected to a variety of stress factors, including environmental conditions, animal management, or diets that can disrupt the intestinal ecosystem and increase the risk of pathogenic infections.

In the swine industry, transition from a liquid to a solid diet during weaning and post-weaning is a critical process due to a significant decrease in feed intake, which impairs animal performance, immune function, microbiota, and gut homeostasis.
These performance stages lead to the end of the transfer of passive maternal immunity from sows to piglets, who have an immature or developing immune system.
This makes piglets highly susceptible to intestinal pathogens such as enterotoxigenic E. coli.

facts_entailed: There are transposable elements (TES) dispersed in the mammalian genome.
The rise of TES was noted due to the completion of the whole human genome sequence.
TES were previously considered 'junk DNA' but now account for approximately 45% of the human genome.
TES can be categorized by features including the capacity to mobilize themselves, DNA/RNA intermediation, and the presence of a long terminal repeat (LTR).
Endogenous retroviruses (ERVs) and long interspersed elements (LINEs) have gene-encoding enzymatic machinery that can mobilize to other genomic regions as autonomous elements.

facts_entailed: Sarcomas are a group of very uncommon malignant tumors that compromise 1% of all adult malignancies.
Approximately 11,590 new diagnoses and 3,560 deaths from soft tissue sarcomas (STS) and bone sarcomas occur annually in the United States.
Isolated pulmonary metastases from STS occur in 20 - 50% of these patients.
70% of these patients will have disease limited only to the lungs.
Once systemic metastatic disease develops, the prognosis is typically poor.
Patients with extremity sarcomas are more likely to develop distant metastatic disease as the initial site of recurrence.
Patients with retroperitoneal and visceral sarcomas tend to present local recurrence.
Although considerable progress has been achieved in both chemotherapy and surgical treatment of STS, pulmonary.

 it introduces a new approach to reimbursement , which is based upon a defined  clinical product .  in contrast , under retrospective cost - based reimbursement , each component of the process of care ( each visit , x - ray , procedure , and day of care ) was paid for separately . 
 that open - ended payment system has proved too inflationary ; federal outlays for medicare have increased from $ 1.1 billion in 1966 to $ 51 billion in 1982 , a rate of inflation which has outpaced the gross national product , the consumer price index , the median family income , and other benchmarks of the economy 's growth . under the prospective payment system

facts_entailed: The new DRG-based prospective payment system (PPS) for Medicare is a revolutionary concept in health care finance.
It introduces a new approach to reimbursement, which is based upon a defined clinical product.
Under retrospective cost-based reimbursement, each component of the process of care (each visit, x-ray, procedure, and day of care) was paid for separately.
An open-ended payment system has proved too inflationary.
Under the prospective payment system, there are shifts in Medicare.

obstructive sleep apnea ( osa ) is a highly prevalent and underdiagnosed disease.1 a recent large clinical trial established osa as a novel risk factor for sudden cardiac death ( scd).2 after 20 years of followup , the busselton health study cohort showed that moderate to severe sleep apnea was independently associated with an increased risk of allcause mortality.3 in a longitudinal study of 10  701 adults , osa was associated with scd , and the magnitude of risk varied with osa severity.2 
  qt prolongation is an independent risk factor for scd,4 , 5 , 6 and osa is associated with longer qt intervals.7 , 8 this electrocardiographic effect is thought to be caused by systemic hypoxia , hypercarbia , or acidosis . 
 the most effective treatment for osa is continuous positive airway pressure
facts_entailed: The prevalence of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is high and it is often undiagnosed.
In a longitudinal study of 10,701 adults, OSA was linked to SCD, with the risk varying based on OSA severity.
QT prolongation is identified as an independent risk factor for SCD.
Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is associated with longer QT intervals.
The most effective treatment for OSA is continuous positive airway pressure.

parkinson 's disease ( pd ) is a debilitating neurologic disorder characterized clinically by bradykinesia , resting tremor , rigidity , and postural instability with a therapeutic response to levodopa . 
 pathophysiologically , pd is characterized by the loss of dopamine neurons in the substantia nigra ( sn ) pars compacta and by the presence of intracellular inclusions known as lewy bodies , which are composed primarily of alpha - synuclein protein aggregates . 
 although the disease etiology remains largely unclear , generation of reactive oxygen species during oxidation of dopamine ( da ) could be one of the factors leading to the selective loss of nigral dopaminergic neurons in pd ( spina and cohen , 1989 ) . 
 the vesicular monoamine transporter type 2 ( vmat2 , slc18a2 ) uptakes cyt
facts_entailed: Parkinson's disease (PD) is a debilitating neurologic disorder characterized clinically by bradykinesia, resting tremor, rigidity, and postural instability.
The therapeutic response to PD treatment is levodopa.
Pathophysiologically, PD is characterized by the loss of dopamine neurons in the substantia nigra (SN) pars compacta and the presence of intracellular inclusions known as Lewy bodies.
Lewy bodies are composed primarily of alpha-synuclein protein aggregates.
The cause of Parkinson's disease etiology remains largely unclear.
One potential factor leading to the selective loss of nigral dopaminergic neurons in PD is the generation of reactive oxygen species during dopamine oxidation (Spina and Cohen, 1989).

facts_entailed: A single-center retrospective analysis of seven patients with pelvic abscesses treated by eus transrectal drainage between January 2010 and August 2014 was conducted.
There were four men and three women, with a median age of 50 years (range 22-68).

facts_entailed: The relative risk of gastric carcinoma in infected persons is 2.3 to 8.3 times greater than that in the normal population.
According to the World Health Organization (WHO) classification, H. pylori has been classified as Group I carcinogens.
It has been suggested that infection with this organism starts in infancy, and most cases occur before adulthood.

facts_entailed: The classification of chronic sialadenitis has changed in the past decade and new diagnostic and therapeutic methods have been introduced.
High-resolution ultrasonography, CT, MR sialography, sonoelastography, and sialendoscopy are new diagnostic and therapeutic methods.
Sialolithiasis is the most common cause of inflammatory diseases of large salivary glands.
Sialolithiasis occurs in about 1.2% of the population and is mostly found in the submandibular gland.

facts_entailed: Diabetes mellitus (dm) is one of the most common chronic metabolic diseases.
The prevalence of dm for all age groups worldwide was estimated to be 2.8% in 2000 and projected to be 4.4% by 2030.
The total number of people with dm is expected to rise from 171 million to 366 million during this period.
Several explanations have been provided for the increase in dm prevalence.
Diabetes poses a challenge to those living with the disease, their families, communities, and the health care system.

facts_entailed: Core autism symptoms such as social communication deficits have proven difficult to change through social skills training (Rao et al. 2008).
Several large-scale interventions for young children with autism, such as pivotal response treatment, meet American Psychological Association criteria for probable efficacy.
Therapeutic treatment programs for school-aged children with an autism spectrum disorder (ASD) have not achieved this level of empirical support.
There are no known methodologically rigorous studies of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for core autism symptoms.
Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) may be well-suited for this indication.
This paper presents preliminary results on the impact of CBT on parental reports of core autism symptoms in 711-year-olds.

facts_entailed: pseudocholinesterase ( pche ) is an enzyme with a complex molecular structure.
pseudocholinesterase ( pche ) is synthesized in the liver and immediately released into the plasma.
The plasma half-life of pseudocholinesterase ( pche ) has been estimated to be approximately 12 days.
Deficiency or reduced activity of pseudocholinesterase ( pche ) results in significant prolongation of mivacurium- or succinylcholine-induced neuromuscular blockade.
Mivacurium is a nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocking drug administered in doses of 0.1 to 0.2 mg/kg.
Mivacurium produces a rapid onset of neuromuscular blockade lasting for 15 to 30 minutes.
The rapid ester hydrolysis of mivacurium by pseudocholinesterase ( pche ) results in the short duration of action of this drug.

lymphangioma circumscriptum ( lc ) or microcystic lymphatic malformation is a hamartomatous malformation of the lymphatic channels of the skin . 
 treatment of lc is difficult because of the persistent nature of the disease due to deeper subcutaneous cisternal connections . 
 we report here a case of lc treated effectively with radiofrequency ablation without any recurrence . 
 a 16-year - old male with fitzpatrick skin type v presented to our clinic with partially fluid - filled lesions on left upper arm with slight local swelling . 
 the patient had these lesions since the age of 2 years and had been repeatedly treated with antibiotics for local infection .

facts_entailed: Lymphangioma circumscriptum (LC) or microcystic lymphatic malformation is a hamartomatous malformation of the skin's lymphatic channels.
Treatment of LC is difficult due to its persistent nature and deeper subcutaneous cisternal connections.
A 16-year-old male with Fitzpatrick skin type V presented to the clinic with partially fluid-filled lesions on the left upper arm and slight local swelling.
The patient had these lesions since the age of 2 years and was repeatedly treated with antibiotics for local infections.
Examination showed a well-defined plaque on the left upper arm with grouped vesicular lesions, giving the typical appearance of a LC.

facts_entailed: A patient was immediately referred to the department after an epidural endoscopy with severe bilateral visual impairment and underwent a complete ophthalmologic examination.
A 45-year-old man suffered from low back pain that was unresponsive to pharmacologic treatment, radiating to the left hip and left lower extremity, due to a back injury 4 years prior.
The patient underwent an epidural endoscopy and endoscopic adhesiolysis at the level of L4-L5 and S1 using 120 cc of normal saline as the infusion medium.
At the end of the procedure, the patient received an epidural injection of 80 mg methylprednisolone.

 using new methods capable of annotating repetitive sequences that have substantially diverged from known te sequences , recent analyses indicate that up to 6669% of the human genome may be composed of repetitive sequences , predominately in the form of tes . 
 tes , as their name implies , are able to move about in the genome and create interspersed repeats . 
 tes include dna transposons , long - terminal repeat ( ltr ) retrotransposons and non - ltr retrotransposons . in this review

facts_entailed: The human genome is laden with repetitive sequences in the form of transposable elements (TE) and tandem repeats.
Transposable elements (TE) make up 45% of the human genome.
Tandem repeats make up 3% of the human genome.
Transposable elements (TE) are able to move about in the genome and create interspersed repeats.
Transposable elements (TE) include DNA transposons, long-terminal repeat (LTR) retrotransposons, and non-LTR retrotransposons.
Non-LTR retrotransposons are the only active TE in the human genome.

one important and interesting problem in genome research is the prediction of transcription factor binding sites ( tfbss ) . 
 binding of transcription factors to their dna binding sites in the regulatory region of a gene is a prerequisite for its activation or repression . 
 the combinatorial presence of tfbss controls gene regulation at least partially , and the prediction of tfbss is of importance for unraveling the underlying molecular mechanisms . 
 wet - lab experiments allow the identification of tfbss , but these experiments are expensive and time consuming . computational methods , which are often less accurate but easy to conduct with available resources , are a welcome complementation to wet - lab experiments .

facts_entailed: One important and interesting problem in genome research is the prediction of transcription factor binding sites (tfbss).
Binding of transcription factors to their DNA binding sites in the regulatory region of a gene is a prerequisite for its activation or repression.
The combinatorial presence of tfbss controls gene regulation at least partially.
Wet-lab experiments allow the identification of tfbss, but these experiments are expensive and time consuming.
Many tfbss prediction algorithms employ statistical models for scoring.

the developing vertebrate heart tube contains an outer layer of myocardium and an inner layer of endocardium separated by an extracellular matrix ( ecm ) referred to as the cardiac jelly . during heart valve formation 
 , a subset of endocardial cells in the atrioventricular ( av ) canal ( avc ) region is specified to delaminate , differentiate , and migrate into the cardiac jelly in a process called endocardial - mesenchymal transition ( emt ) ( armstrong and bischoff , 2004 ; combs and yutzey , 2009 ) .

facts_entailed: The developing vertebrate heart tube contains an outer layer of myocardium and an inner layer of endocardium separated by an extracellular matrix ( ECM ) referred to as the cardiac jelly.

During heart valve formation, a subset of endocardial cells in the atrioventricular (AV) canal (AVC) region is specified to delaminate, differentiate, and migrate into the cardiac jelly in a process called endocardial-mesenchymal transition (EMT).

For AV valve formation, locally swollen cardiac jelly together with mesenchymal cells derived from AVC endocardial cells form the endocardial cushion; however, the extensive remodeling process that occurs subsequently is not clearly understood.

facts_entailed: Schwannoma may arise from any peripheral nerve and is often found in the chest wall and posterior mediastinum.
However, case reports of intrapulmonary schwannoma are extremely rare.
A 38-year-old man was referred to the institution because of an abnormal shadow found incidentally on the chest x-ray.
The plain chest x-ray showed a mass lesion in the left middle zone.
Chest computed tomography (CT) showed a round and homogeneous mass 25 × 18 mm in size with a well-defined margin in the lingular segment of the left upper lobe.
18-F-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron-emission tomography (PET) showed no accumulation in the tumor.
The CT and FDG-PET findings suggested the possibility of a benign tumor or a low-grade malignancy.

facts_entailed: Lesions larger than 3 cm are described as lung masses.
Micronodules are usually applied to very small nodules (less than 7 mm or less than 5 mm), which are almost always multiple and diffuse.
If only one pulmonary nodule is detected, it is described as a solitary pulmonary nodule (SPN).
An incidental nodule is a nodule detected during an examination not performed specifically for the purpose of searching for pulmonary nodules.

 treatment of pelvic trauma is difficult since hemorrhage can be massive and it is difficult to apply direct pressure to the bleeding vessels .

facts_entailed: Clinical presentations vary from nonspecific systemic symptoms such as fever, myalgia, palpitation, chest pain, and dyspnea to fulminant hemodynamic collapse and sudden death.
Infections caused by viral, bacterial, fungal, protozoal, parasitic sources, toxins, immunological syndromes, and hypersensitivity can lead to myocarditis.
Lewin et al. reported that seven explanted hearts from 288 heart transplants (2.4%) had histological evidence of hypersensitivity myocarditis.
The prognosis of hypersensitivity myocarditis is generally excellent, often improving after the causative drug is discontinued.
We report a case of hypersensitivity myocarditis, which was confirmed by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and endomyocardial biopsy.

liver cancer is the second most common cause of cancer - related death worldwide , the fifth most common cancer among men and the ninth most common cancer among women.1 hepatocellular carcinoma ( hcc ) is responsible for ~90% of primary liver cancers.2 in the united states , hcc is the fastest rising cause of cancer - related death , and its incidence has nearly tripled since the 1980s.3,4 despite increased focus and research , the overall prognosis for hcc remains poor . 
 curative modalities , such as liver transplant , resection and radiofrequency ablation , do exist when hcc is diagnosed early ; however , only ~15% of patients are eligible for such treatments ( table 1).3,5,6 the majority of patients are diagnosed with advanced - stage hcc , for which the median survival time is < 50%
facts_entailed: Liver cancer is the second most common cause of cancer-related death worldwide, the fifth most common cancer among men, and the ninth most common cancer among women.
Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is responsible for ~90% of primary liver cancers.
In the United States, HCC is the fastest rising cause of cancer-related death, and its incidence has nearly tripled since the 1980s.
Despite increased focus and research, the overall prognosis for HCC remains poor.
Curative modalities, such as liver transplant, resection, and radiofrequency ablation, do exist when HCC is diagnosed early; however, only ~15% of patients are eligible for such treatments (table 1).

facts_entailed: The analysis was part of the diabetes and informatics (Dai) study.
The Dai study is a multicenter cohort study conducted by the Dai Study Group (Diainf) and the Italian Association of Clinical Diabetologists (AMD) and the Italian National Institute of Health (ISS).

The aim of the Dai study was to evaluate the prevalence and incidence of CVD (myocardial infarction, ischemic heart disease [IHD], percutaneous coronary intervention angioplasty [PTCA], coronary artery bypass graft [CABG], stroke, and peripheral amputations) among type 2 diabetic patients attending hospital-based diabetes clinics in Italy.
In Italy, a public network of 700 diabetes clinics provides care for up to 80% of patients with known diabetes.

electrophysiological brain signals are widely studied to get insights into the inner function of the brain . 
 the electro - encephalogram ( eeg ) , as an example , has been analyzed for decades and is particularly popular because of its noninvasiveness , wide availability , relatively small cost and excellent temporal resolution which enables capturing the fast neural dynamics . because it is known that electrophysiological brain signals exhibit important spectral characteristics , frequency transforms are often applied . 
 however , since in general brain signals do not possess the statistical property of stationarity , time - frequency transforms are of special interest . 
 such methods are able to represent a given signal jointly in the time - frequency domain , called its time - frequ
facts_entailed: Electrophysiological brain signals are widely studied to gain insights into the inner function of the brain.

The electro-encephalogram (EEG) has been analyzed for decades and is particularly popular due to its noninvasiveness, wide availability, relatively small cost, and excellent temporal resolution, which enables capturing fast neural dynamics.
Frequency transforms are often applied because electrophysiological brain signals exhibit important spectral characteristics.
Since in general brain signals do not possess the statistical property of stationarity, time-frequency transforms are of special interest.
Such methods are able to represent a given signal jointly in the time-frequency domain, called its time-frequency representation.

duodeno - duodenal intussusception , which involves the distal invagination of a segment of the duodenum , is a rare condition owing to the retroperitoneal fixation of the duodenum , which is sometime absent in cases of intestinal malrotation . 
 the vast majority ( 8090% ) of cases of intestinal intussusception are secondary to pathological masses in the intestine , such as brunner s gland hamartomas , lipomas and adenomas . 
 the presence of a duodenal membrane may cause retention of food resembling a pathologic mass , which may in turn facilitate intussusception . 
 we describe the interesting case of a patient with intestinal malrotation who developed acute pancreatitis as a result of a duodenal intussusception involving the head of pancreas which was caused by a duodenal membrane .
facts_entailed: This condition is rare and can be due to retroperitoneal fixation of the duodenum, which is sometimes absent in cases of intestinal malrotation.
The vast majority (80-90%) of cases of intestinal intussusception are secondary to pathological masses in the intestine, such as Brunner's gland hamartomas, lipomas, and adenomas.
The presence of a duodenal membrane may cause food retention, resembling a pathologic mass, which can facilitate intussusception.

We describe an interesting case of a patient with intestinal malrotation who developed acute pancreatitis due to a duodenal intussusception involving the head of the pancreas caused by a duodenal membrane.

facts_entailed: The regulated expression of different families of retrotransposons and DNA transposons has been described in different tissues and species.
A detailed analysis of the transcripts or their temporal and spatial expression patterns has been reported in only a few cases.
Drosophila embryogenesis has seen spatial differential expression of the retrotransposon 412, specifically in the gonadal mesoderm.
In mouse, retrotransposons make a high contribution to the pool of maternal mRNAs in early embryos, and the expression of these elements is developmentally regulated.
In Xenopus, the 1a11 retrotransposon-like element is specifically expressed in the mesoderm and its expression is regulated by FGF.
Likewise, the expression of the retrotransposon family in Xenopus is regulated by FGF.

child abuse is defined as any physical or emotional injury which causes harm or substantive risk of harm to the child 's health or welfare .

 types of child abuse , include physical abuse , emotional abuse and neglect , healthcare neglect ( medical and dental ) , physical neglect , sexual abuse , failure to thrive , safety neglect , intentional poisoning , and munchausen syndrome by proxy ( fabricated or induced illness by parent ) .

facts_entailed: Child abuse is defined as any physical or emotional injury that causes harm or a substantial risk of harm to the child's health or welfare.
Child abuse includes sexual abuse, neglect, or being physically dependent upon an addictive drug at birth.

Types of child abuse include physical abuse, emotional abuse, neglect, healthcare neglect (medical and dental), physical neglect, sexual abuse, failure to thrive, safety neglect, intentional poisoning, and Munchausen syndrome by proxy (fabricated or induced illness by parent).

Factors contributing to child abuse include stress (e.g., life crises such as unemployment or homelessness), lack of a support network, substance/alcohol abuse, learned behavior (many abusers were previously victims), and other forms of family violence.

facts_entailed: A 59-year-old female with a family history of MCD presented to the clinic with progressive loss of vision over a 40-year period.
Multiple irregular grayish-white, dense, poorly delineated spots were found in the stroma.
Her family history was unclear due to her parents' early death.
Her only son, who is 37 years old, complained of foggy vision.
His slit lamp examination showed a similar but less severe corneal appearance compared to his mother's condition.
One year post-operatively, the patient had a best-corrected visual acuity of 20/100 OD and a clear cornea graft.
Informed consent was obtained from the patient and her son according to the Declaration of Helsinki.

the adverse consequences of the acquired immune deficiency syndrome ( aids ) or t cell immunodeficiency provide evidence of the vital role of cytotoxic t - lymphocytes ( ctl ) in the immune response . 
 indeed , ctl are well - known elements of the immune response to virus - infected , tumour and allogeneic cells [ 13 ] . 
 more recently , the role of ctl was expanded significantly when the ability to mediate direct killing of microbial pathogens was identified . 
 research defining the precise mechanisms underlying ctl killing of microbes , however , is still in its infancy . 
 remarkably , granulysin ( in contrast to granzymes ) has emerged as a fundamental mediator of microbial killing . 
 the mode of action of granulysin appears to be through the disruption of membrane permeability .
facts_entailed: The acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS) or T cell immunodeficiency can lead to adverse consequences.
The role of CTL was expanded when it was found that they could mediate direct killing of microbial pathogens.
Research into the precise mechanisms of CTL killing of microbes is still ongoing.
Granulysin has emerged as a fundamental mediator of microbial killing.
The mode of action of granulysin involves the disruption of membrane permeability.

skin tissue integrity is a crucial factor to maintain the homeostasis generated through physical barriers , separating the organism from the environment . 
 every disruption of dermal integrity triggers a complicated cascade of events , including rapid blood clot formation , inflammatory response , and wound healing , leading to the restoration of the integrity and formation of new tissue . 
 however , repaired structures , known as scars , are nonfunctioning , tight , and tense masses of fibrotic tissue that maintain 7080% of normal strength , with even less flexibility . 
 inflammatory responses are necessary for wound healing , preventing multiple infection and contamination and stimulating the proliferation , revascularization , and remodeling of the extracellular matrix [ 2 , 3 ] .
facts_entailed: Skin tissue integrity is a crucial factor to maintain the homeostasis generated through physical barriers, separating the organism from the environment.

Inflammatory responses are necessary for wound healing, preventing multiple infections and contamination and stimulating the proliferation, revascularization, and remodeling of the extracellular matrix [2, 3].

facts_entailed: Acinetobacter baumannii is an opportunistic pathogen that is frequently involved in outbreaks of infection occurring mostly in intensive care units.
Members of the genus Acinetobacter are gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming encapsulated coccobacilli belonging to the family Neisseriaceae.

It is an opportunistic pathogen found to be associated with a wide spectrum of infection including nosocomial pneumonia, meningitis, endocarditis, skin and soft tissue infections, urinary tract infection, conjunctivitis, burn wound infection, and bacteremia, posing a risk for high mortality.
Pneumonia generally occurs in patients with diminished host defenses (e.g., alcoholism, tobacco use, diabetes mellitus, and renal failure, underlying pulmonary disease).

facts_entailed: Three types of bone graft are used: autograft (autologous graft), allograft, and alloplastic graft.

An alloplastic graft is a synthetic substitute, usually created from ceramics (calcium phosphate, calcium sulfate, or bioactive glass), polymer (derivative from acrylic), or growth factors (the family of bone morphogenetic proteins).
Approximately 500,000 surgical site infections caused by bacteria and viruses occur every year.

It starts in the nucleus.
Transcription factors bind to specific DNA sequences proximal to the genes they regulate and recruit RNA polymerases for RNA synthesis.

Messenger RNA-binding proteins (MRBPs) associate with nascent mRNA precursors and mediate diverse RNA processing reactions including 5-end capping, splicing, editing, 3-end cleavage, and polyadenylation [24].

 it is believed that , in genetically predisposed individuals , interaction between local microbiota and the intestinal mucosa can cause chronic inflammation and ulceration [ 79 ] .

facts_entailed: Crohn's disease (CD) is a form of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
Crohn's disease affects the entire gastrointestinal (GI) tract.
It is believed that in genetically predisposed individuals, interaction between local microbiota and the intestinal mucosa can cause chronic inflammation and ulceration.
A key pathological feature of Crohn's disease is a granulomatous inflammatory response.
This response is characterized by the presence of epithelioid and multinucleated giant cells as well as macrophage infiltration.
The onset and development of the inflammatory reaction in Crohn's disease depend on the persistence of an inciting agent, leading to a chronic condition.

This site of Taranto is of interest due to several polluting sources including a large steel plant, a refinery, the harbor, and both controlled and illegal waste dumps.

facts_entailed: Simultaneous bipolar dislocation of the clavicle is uncommon and unusual.
Panclavicular dislocation, floating clavicle, and complete dislocation of the clavicle are alternative terms for simultaneous bipolar dislocation of the clavicle.
Most bipolar clavicular dislocations have been treated non-operatively according to a review of the recent literature.
A 23-year-old polytrauma patient presented with simultaneous dislocation of the right clavicle.
On radiographic assessment, a simultaneous dislocation of the coraco-clavicular and sterno-clavicular joints of the right side was diagnosed.
The patient had an unstable coraco-clavicular joint 2 weeks post-injury.
A decision was made based on the unstable condition of the right clavicle, the young age of the patient, and the requirement of high physical activity.

 nscs in the svz , so called type - b cells , are of astrocytic lineage and generate transient amplifying type - c cells .

facts_entailed: The neural stem cells (NSCs) are multipotent cells capable of generating various cell types in the central nervous system (CNS), including neurons, astrocytes, and oligodendrocytes (Alvarez-Buylla et al., 2002).

In adult mammals, neurogenesis is primarily limited to two brain regions: the subventricular zone (SVZ) by the lateral ventricles and the subgranular zone (SGZ) of the dentate gyrus in the hippocampus (reviewed in Zhao et al., 2008).
NSCs in the SVZ, known as type-B cells, originate from an astrocytic lineage and differentiate into transient amplifying type-C cells.

facts_entailed: Torus hyperplasia is also known as focal pyloric hypertrophy.
Focal pyloric hypertrophy is a very rare condition.
The lesion is caused by a circular muscle hypertrophy affecting the lesser curvature near the pylorus.
The pathogenesis of the lesion is unclear.
Some consider it a persistence of infantile pyloric hypertrophy into adulthood.
Others note that it develops within a few weeks in adults.
Some speculate that the lesion results from chronic gastritis.
Others suggest it develops due to repeated spastic contractions of the area.
These contractions may be triggered by visceral- visceral reflexes.
Local irritation could stimulate afferent fibers and start a reflex arc involving efferents that innervate the circular pyloric musculature.

facts_entailed: The incidence of non-Hodgkin lymphoma is rising worldwide.
Non-Hodgkin lymphoma is higher in developed countries than in Africa and Asia.
B cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma is a typical extrahepatic manifestation frequently associated with hepatitis C virus infection.
The prevalence of hepatitis C virus infection in patients with B cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma is approximately 15%.
The HCV envelope protein E2 binds human CD81, a tetraspanin expressed on various types of cells, including lymphocytes, and activates B cell proliferation.
Infection and replication of HCV were observed in B cells [6, 7].
The direct effects of HCV infection on B cells in vivo have not been clarified.

 successful control of this pathogen depends on the early production of the proinflammatory cytokines il-12 and ifn- , required for the development of a protective cell - mediated immune response against the parasite [ 25 ] . 
 although neutrophils and macrophages produce il-12 in response to t. gondii infection or its soluble antigens ( stag ) [ 69 ] , in vivo studies indicate that cd8 and cd11b dendritic cell ( dc ) populations may be the most important sources of this proinflammatory cytokine during acute infection [ 1012 ] .

facts_entailed: Toxoplasma gondii (t. gondii) is an obligate intracellular protozoan parasite that causes toxoplasmosis, a usually asymptomatic disease in most immune-competent individuals but potentially severe in immune-compromised hosts.
Successful control of this pathogen depends on the early production of the proinflammatory cytokines IL-12 and IFN-.
Neutrophils and macrophages produce IL-12 in response to t. gondii infection or its soluble antigens (stag).
In vivo studies indicate that CD8 and CD11b dendritic cell (DC) populations may be the most important sources of this proinflammatory cytokine during acute infection.

A significant goal for the application of antithrombogenic biomaterial is to prevent thrombus formation on the material surface.

 this was an open , non - comparative study of seven weeks duration with an initial placebo run in period of one week . 
 one hundred and forty - four patients completed the study as per protocol and 151 patients were safety evaluable . 
 one hundred and eleven patients ( 77% ) received one tablet of fdc of olanzapine 5 mg / fluoxetine 20 mg once daily for 6 weeks , in patients ( 14% ) , the dose was stepped up at the end of 2 weeks to 2 tablets of fdc of olanzapine 5 mg/ fluoxetine 20 mg once daily for a further 4 weeks and 13 patients ( 9% ) required dose to be stepped up at the e
facts_entailed: The purpose of the study was to investigate the efficacy and safety of a fixed dose combination (fdc) of olanzapine 5 mg and fluoxetine 20 mg in Indian patients with severe or treatment resistant depression.
The study had a duration of seven weeks and included an initial one-week placebo run-in period.
One hundred and forty-four patients completed the study according to the protocol.
Seventy-one patients (77%) received one tablet of the fdc of olanzapine 5 mg/fluoxetine 20 mg once daily for six weeks.
In 14% of patients, the dose was stepped up to two tablets of the fdc of olanzapine 5 mg/fluoxetine 20 mg once daily for the following four weeks.
Treatment required dose escalation in 13 patients (9%).

facts_entailed: For ensuring post-endodontic restorations, fiber posts are used commonly to provide tooth function and form with adequate force distribution.
The placement of a post is often needed for the restoration of a root canal treated tooth to support the core material.
Circular fiber posts have recently gained popularity due to the requirement for aesthetics, and these materials are developed gradually.
The lack of adaptation of circular posts to the canal walls is filled with resin cements.
The major factor for the clinical performance of post-supported restorations is the cement thickness.

facts_entailed: The pediatric soft-tissue sarcomas (STSs) account for approximately 7% of all childhood tumors.
Out of this, surgery is the mainstay of treatment for STSs.
The advent of neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NACT) has reduced the incidence of recurrence/metastasis.
A case of IFs with early and unusual distant metastasis was presented, localized on fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography-computed tomography (FDG PET-CT) scan.
The patient was a 4-year-old girl child who had primary involvement of the right proximal tibia.
Whole-body PET/MR scan was not suggestive of disease elsewhere at the time of presentation.
The patient was detected with local relapse 3 months after initial diagnosis.
For the local relapse, she underwent chemotherapy followed by right above-knee amputation.

facts_entailed: We studied 1,297 patients with type 1 diabetes from the nationwide finnish diabetic nephropathy study (finndiane).
Patients were required to have an onset of diabetes before 35 years of age and initiation of permanent insulin treatment within 1 year of diagnosis.
Patients were classified into four groups based on the urinary albumin excretion rate (AER) or the presence of end-stage renal disease (ESRD) (table 1).
Patients with normal AER were required to have a duration of diabetes over 15 years.
Serum concentration of MBL was determined in 1,064 patients (available in the supplemental methods at http://diabetes.diabetesjournals.org/cgi/content/full/db08-1495/dc1).
For nondiabetic control subjects, 701 Finnish blood donors (49% men; mean age 46.1 years) were used.

facts_entailed: gwas2 included 450 unrelated generalized vitiligo patients (cases) of non-hispanic/latino European ancestry (eur) from North America and Europe, who met strict clinical criteria for generalized vitiligo.

Controls for gwas2 were 3182 eur individuals not specifically known to have any autoimmune disease or malignant melanoma, for whom genome-wide genotypes were obtained from the Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbgap; phs000092v1, phs000125v1, phs000138v2, phs000168v1, and phs000206v3), or from the Illumina iControlDB.

The replication study included 1440 unrelated eur generalized vitiligo cases and 1316 unrelated eur controls from North America and Europe, principally spouses of vitiligo patients from the gwas2 study and the replication study itself.

facts_entailed: Now, elderly patients need more attention.
The average life expectancy continues to increase among the elderly population.
Orthopaedic surgeons will encounter more intertrochanteric fractures as a consequence.
Intertrochanteric fractures are associated with high rates of mortality ranging from 15 to 20%.
Elderly patients are at a high risk for deep vein thrombosis (DVT), urinary tract infections, and pulmonary embolism if they do not mobilize or ambulate early.
Surgical stabilization aims to facilitate early mobilization and union in an anatomical position.
Surgical stabilization, specifically through operative stabilization, is now considered the gold standard treatment for intertrochanteric fractures.
Although other options exist, the standard approach for treating intertrochanteric fractures is the dynamic hip screw (DHS).

 their poor permeability across cellular membranes ( due to their intrinsic polyanionic nature and high molecular weight ) and susceptibility to degradation by ubiquitous nucleases hamper their clinical translation .

facts_entailed: Their poor permeability across cellular membranes (due to their intrinsic polyanionic nature and high molecular weight) and susceptibility to degradation by ubiquitous nucleases hinder their clinical translation.
Recent advances in the development of various delivery vehicles (e.g., polymer-, lipid-, peptide-, nano/microparticles-, or viral-based) have helped overcome these challenges.

facts_entailed: Individuals grading their own performance is a self-teaching exercise that improves future treatment quality.
Orthodontic treatment assessment traditionally relies on subjective opinion and clinician experiences.
Subjective evaluations using criteria from different orthodontists can lead to variability and lack reproducibility.
Visual Analog Scale (VAS) has been widely used for subjective assessment of various indices.

NK cells undergo brief, exploratory interactions with multiple cell types.
It is not known what molecules specifically mediate these interactions.
There are a number of candidate receptors expressed on resting or primed NK cells.
Receptors include tethering receptors such as CD62L and PSL-1.
Potentially more robust adhesion receptors are also involved.

facts_entailed: The key to successful intensive care is appropriate timing of treatment.
Lange and colleagues reported in this issue of critical care.
They investigated the time course of the expression of different isoforms of nitric oxide synthase (NOS).
The different isoforms of NOS include neuronal NOS (nNOS), inducible NOS (iNOS), and endothelial NOS (eNOS).
Markers of nitrosative stress include tissue levels of nitrotyrosine and poly(ADP-ribose).
DNA damage resulting from peroxynitrite formation can be measured using these markers.
p65 is a marker of the activation of the nuclear factor-kappa-B (NF-κB).
This research was conducted in a well-established resuscitated ovine model of septic shock induced by peritonitis.

facts_entailed: The steroid hormones have been traditionally associated with regulation of peripheral organs.
Stress is associated with the hormone corticosterone.
Gonadal function is associated with the hormones estrogen and androgens.
These hormones also act within the hypothalamus in a feedback regulatory loop.
This feedback loop affects the release of neural factors that modulate steroid hormone production.
Over the years, it became evident that steroid hormones act within the hypothalamus.
New roles of steroid hormones in modulating higher CNS functions have been elucidated more recently.
Stress and steroid hormones have been shown to affect synaptic receptors and ion channels.
These effects regulate synaptic transmission and neuronal plasticity.
Stress hormones have been implicated in processes.

facts_entailed: Primary amenorrhea is the absence of menstruation and secondary sexual characteristics in phenotypic women aged 14 years or older.
Common hormonal causes of primary amenorrhea include pituitary dysfunction, chronic systemic disease, and absent ovarian function.
Gonadal failure in genetically XX individuals is ovarian failure; this results in primary amenorrhea and incomplete breast development when it occurs before sexual maturation.
XY individuals with gonadal failure will have female genitalia because Müllerian inhibiting factor and testosterone will not be produced.
Gonadal tumors occur in up to 25% of women with a Y chromosome; these gonads do not secrete hormones and should be removed at the time of diagnosis.

The patient had a background history of multicore myopathy resulting in progressive scoliosis.
On the anesthetic chart, endotracheal intubation was noted to be difficult (grade III on the Cormack and Lehane scale).

facts_entailed: The risk of varices bleeding in patients with portal hypertension was approximately 30% over 2 years.
The treatment for patients with varices hemorrhage mainly depends on medical treatment, endoscopic therapy, and surgical shunting procedures.
Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunts (TIPS) are currently widely used to prevent or control variceal rebleeding.
TIPS could serve as a bridge to hepatic transplantation or fit for patients who are in need of portal decompression.
TIPS is usually regarded as a first-line therapy and cost-effective solution to portal hypertension concomitantly.

facts_entailed: Tumor angiogenesis has been implicated as a major factor in the development and spread of these metastases.

The recent discovery of vascular endothelial growth factor-C (VEGF-C) and vegf receptor-3 (VEGFR-3) involvement in lymphatic vessel development and specific lymphatic markers has provided new insights into the field of lymphangiogenesis.
Studies have suggested that lymphangiogenesis plays an active role in the formation and spread of colorectal liver metastases (CLM).
The patterns of intratumoral lymphatics may have potential clinical significance as a predictive marker of disease recurrence and patient survival.

facts_entailed: It is easy to happen following fistula formation, bad wound healing, and tumor recurrence.
In 2% of cases, carotid blow-out syndrome is bilateral.
The syndrome occurred in a patient undergoing reoperation for recurrent thyroid cancer.
Repairing carotid blow-out syndrome involved the remaining carotid sheath, sterno-thyroid muscle, sterno-hyoid muscle, and the harvested external jugular vein.

errors in the health care system are due to a diverse interaction of human behavior , socio - cultural aspects , technical aspects of the system , as well as a range of system weaknesses . various categories of errors present as an overlap between human and system causes . 
 when working conditions lead to circumstances in which it is easy to commit an error , this is known as a  latent error or 
 system failure. lack of experienced staff on duty , leading to staff fatigue and poor administration verdicts for example , may lead to latent errors or system failure . 
 this , in turn , can lead to violation - producing conditions , where an individual has little choice but to violate protocol . 
 this includes knowledge - based errors , rule - based errors , skill - based errors , technical e
facts_entailed: There are various categories of errors present as an overlap between human and system causes.
Errors in the health care system are due to a diverse interaction of human behavior, socio-cultural aspects, technical aspects of the system, as well as a range of system weaknesses.
When working conditions lead to circumstances in which it is easy to commit an error, this is known as a latent error or system failure.
Lack of experienced staff on duty, leading to staff fatigue and poor administration, may lead to latent errors or system failure.
This, in turn, can lead to violation-producing conditions, where an individual has little choice but to violate protocol.
Knowledge-based errors, rule-based errors, skill-based errors, and technical errors are included in violation-producing conditions.

tuberous sclerosis complex ( tsc ) is a genetic disorder that can affect almost all organ systems . 
 renal manifestations occur with high frequency , the most prevalent being angiomyolipoma ( aml ) . 
 tsc - associated amls tend to be larger , more numerous , and more likely to cause spontaneous hemorrhage compared with sporadic amls . 
 removal of renal calculi from kidneys with amls is particularly difficult because these tumors increase the potential for hemorrhage . 
 we report the case of a 65-year - old man with tsc - associated aml and a renal calculus greater than 4 cm in his left kidney . 
 the calculus was successfully removed by retrograde flexible ureterorenoscopy ( f - urs ) with holmium laser lithotripsy .

the diagnosis of unexplained syncopal episodes and sustained palpitations remains a difficult task in clinical cardiology . 
 standard 24 h holter monitoring has a low diagnostic yield , while implantable loop recorder ( ilr ) has a higher diagnostic yield , but it is expensive and mildly invasive , making its role in diagnostic work - up of unexplained syncope and palpitations questionable . 
 the utility of external prolonged electrocardiogram ( ecg ) monitoring in work - up of syncope is still undefined . 
 the few available studies , generally single - centre and retrospective , provided conflicting results , mainly due to heterogeneity of patient populations and devices capabilities . in sustained palpitations , the external loop recorders ( elrs ) utility was more established .

The city of Tshwane is home to over 5,000 businesses.
About 1,734,295 tons of solid waste was produced by the city in 2010-2011.

Businesses in the city produce solid waste that includes items like wood, product packaging, empty bottles, used tires and car parts, cans, garden refuse, furniture, clothing, leftover food, newspapers, wires, grease, appliances, paint, pieces of metal, broken containers, sheet metal, used medicine, and more.
These businesses generate massive volumes of waste.

parkinson 's disease ( pd ) is a neurodegenerative condition characterised clinically as a movement disorder consisting of bradykinesia , rigidity and rest tremor , as a consequence of striatal dopamine depletion secondary to degeneration of the dopaminergic neurons of the substantia nigra . 
 in addition , pathology in other regions results in cognitive deficits and a dementia in some cases , neuropsychiatric manifestations including depression and anxiety , sleep disturbances including rapid - eye movement sleep behavior disorder , and autonomic features ( kalia and lang , 2015 ) . 
 the motor disorder of pd responds well to dopamine - replacement therapies such as levodopa or dopamine agonists . however , systemic administration of dopaminergic agents results in non - physiological rele
facts_entailed: Neuropsychiatric manifestations including depression and anxiety can occur in Parkinson's disease.
Sleep disturbances such as rapid-eye-movement sleep behavior disorder can be associated with Parkinson's disease.
Autonomic features can be observed in Parkinson's disease.
Systemic administration of dopaminergic agents does not result in physiological release in Parkinson's disease.

source: panoramic radiography is a cost - effective , low - dose method used in dental radiology for evaluating oral health status in routine dental practice.1 this technique allows examination of the maxillary and mandibular arches and their supporting structures on a single image.23 the advantages of panoramic radiography are time - saving , broad anatomic coverage , and high patient acceptability.34 abnormalities such as root fragments , impacted teeth , neoplasms , and foreign bodies are often overlooked when they do not cause symptoms or clinical signs.5 panoramic radiography is often used in routine examinations of edentulous jaws to detect asymptomatic conditions such as root fragments , retained teeth , radiolucent lesions , and foreign bodies.67 thus it is a valuable diagnostic tool in pr
facts_entailed: This technique allows examination of the maxillary and mandibular arches and their supporting structures on a single image.
The advantages of panoramic radiography include time-saving, broad anatomic coverage, and high patient acceptability.
Abnormalities such as root fragments, impacted teeth, neoplasms, and foreign bodies are often overlooked when they do not cause symptoms or clinical signs.
Panoramic radiography is often used in routine examinations of edentulous jaws to detect asymptomatic conditions such as root fragments, retained teeth, radiolucent lesions, and foreign bodies.
Thus, it is a valuable diagnostic tool in practice.

spinal epidural lipomatosis ( sel ) is a rare disease that is characterized by pathologic overgrowth of lumbar or thoracic epidural fat tissue . 
 although the etiology of sel is not known , sel has been frequently diagnosed in obese patient groups and exogenous steroid administration groups , so steroid metabolism is presumed to be related with sel . 
 excessive epidural fat deposition in the spinal canal can contribute to various neurologic symptoms , such as back pain , radiculopathy , myelopathy , claudication and even cauda equina syndrome . in this case , we present a sel patient who had taken steroid hormone medicine for 20 years , after a suprasellar tumor resection . 
 she presented with leg weakness and radiating pain on both buttock , posterior thigh & calf for 1 year . 
 becaus
facts_entailed: Spinal epidural lipomatosis (SEL) is a rare disease characterized by pathologic overgrowth of lumbar or thoracic epidural fat tissue.
Steroid metabolism is presumed to be related to SEL.
Excessive epidural fat deposition in the spinal canal can contribute to various neurologic symptoms, including back pain, radiculopathy, myelopathy, claudication, and cauda equina syndrome.

A patient with a history of taking steroid hormone medicine for 20 years and having a suprasellar tumor resection presented with leg weakness and radiating pain on both buttocks, posterior thighs, and calves for 1 year.
